result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scheduling Order
Status hearing on November 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:00 PM Defendant Francisco Marcos Moyotl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David J. Lang Aty appeared by video for Francisco Marcos Moyotl.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF57, 22CF59
Atty Lang states defendant is not contesting that his client is competent.  No objection by Atty Juech.  No objection by defendant.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant competent to  proceed.

22CF59:  Atty Lang states motion for bond modification.  Atty Juech continues with his objection to any bond modification.  
BY THE COURT:  Court denies the motion to modify bond.
Status hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
to Modify Bond
for Zoom Appearance

2:00 PM Defendant Francisco Marcos Moyotl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David J. Lang Aty appeared by video for Francisco Marcos Moyotl.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF57, 22CF59, 22FO62, 22FO63, 22TR525
Court notes that on it's own, raised the issue of competency and a competency examination has been ordered.  There is a hearing set for 10/18/22 and parties should have competency results by that time.  If there is no agreement, a hearing will be scheduled at that time.
No objection by either party.
BY THE COURT:  Court will try to keep this matter moving once examination filed.

2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Francisco Marcos Moyotl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David J. Lang Aty appeared by video for Francisco Marcos Moyotl. 
22CF57, 22CF59, 22FO62, 22FO63, 22TR525
Atty Lang requests speedy trial on 22CF57.  Believes 22CF59 will be settled.
BY THE COURT:  Court will take that as speedy trial request.  Court will set for motions and all should be filed prior to that date.  Court will enter a scheduling order.  Set for status.  Court will also set for bond modification on 22CF59.

to Modify Bail

State has filed the Information.  Atty Lang received the Information and waives it's reading.  Enters Not Guilty plea to all charges.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

1:45 PM Attorney David J. Lang Aty appeared by video for Francisco Marcos Moyotl. 
22CF57, 22CF59
Atty Lang states his client is waiving the preliminary hearing in both cases.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant has no objection to holding hearing by Zoom.  Court questions defendant on his waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty Lang.  Court finds that it is being waived freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

3:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Francisco Marcos Moyotl in court, in custody.  Attorney David J. Lang Aty appeared by video for Francisco Marcos Moyotl. 
22CF59 & 22CF57 tracking together:
Atty Lang states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaints in both matters & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties in both cases.  

Atty Lang makes bail arguments.
Atty Burdon makes bail arguments.  

BY THE COURT:  Cash bail will remain as is; motion to modify the cash bail is denied.

Court questions time limits.  Atty Lang does not waive time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim within 10 days

records.addlTxt: Notice Regarding Posting Bond
*No contact with Victim 1, Witness 1 and Witness 2 or their residence

3:21 PM Defendant Francisco Marcos Moyotl appeared by video.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Gumz has not been able to speak with the defendant yet.  Court notes that he is going to recuse himself after this hearing.  

Atty Burdon requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.

3:29pm  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz makes arguments on the bond and asks for a signature bond.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Defendant knows the victim and witnesses in the complaint

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Victim 1, Witness 1 and Witness 2 or their residence

BY THE COURT:  Court will recuse himself
Initial Appearance will be set once a new Judge is assigned
